intro: Tetraria pillansii, commonly known as the Pillans' tetraria, is a rare and specialized plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant is native to specific regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and Angola. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Tetraria pillansii is considered a vulnerable species.
